means: 在洗礼时为（某人）命名( christen的现在分词)

sentence.Network_en: He asked Ginny if she would consent to a small celebration after the christening.
sentence.Network_cn: 他问金尼是否同意在洗礼之后小小地庆祝一下。

sentence.Network_en: There was a woman who wanted a christening mug for a baby.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个妇女要买庆贺婴儿受洗礼时命名的杯子.

sentence.Network_en: The day of the christening was sunny and bright.
sentence.Network_cn: 洗礼仪式的天是阳光充足的和明亮的.

entry.tran: 洗礼(基督教仪式，表示正式接纳新教徒，并为之命名)
entry.def: A christening is a Christian ceremony in which a baby is made a member of the Christian church and is officially given his or her name.

means.word_mean: 1. giving a Christian name at baptism

auth_sentence.content: More specific vocabulary is introduced by means of a christening.
